biospec_descr.textblock:
Serum and plasma samples will be obtained Abdominal and thigh subcutaneous adipose tissue
      obtained during surgery

brief_summary.textblock:
The overall goal of this proposal is to characterize the immune cell profile of subcutaneous
      abdominal adipose tissue in lean, overweight and obese adults, and to evaluate potential
      associations between different adipose tissue immune cell types and metabolic profile.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immune Characterization of Subcutaneous Adipose Tissue
clinical_study.condition: Determine Immune Cell Types in Subcutaneous Adipose Tissue

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Women of all races and ethnicity

          -  Age between 18 and 65 years

          -  Body Mass Index (BMI) greater than or equal to 18.5 kg/m2

          -  Weight stable (=/- 3% during the last 2 months before enrollment)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Diabetes Mellitus

          -  Recent (<5 years) history of cancer (except in situ dectal breast carcinoma)

          -  Chemotherapy and/or radiation therapy within 4 months before enrollment

          -  Immune system diseases (i.e., autoimmune disorders, acquired immunodeficiency
             syndrome)

          -  Pregnant or breastfeeding

          -  Take any medication that might affect immune function

          -  Severe organ dysfunction

          -  BMI <24 kg/m2 or size of each breast is >600 grams, if scheduled for bilateral breast
             reconstruction

study_pop.textblock:
50 women scheduled to undergo liposcution/lipectomy procedure for breast reconstruction
        associated with prophylactic mastectomy or mastectomy for in situ ductal breast corcinoma,
        cosmetic surgery, or abdominal lipectomy for severe obesity at either Barnes-Jewish
        Hospital or Barnes-Jewish West County Hospital.  Subjects of all races and ethnicity, with
        a body mass index (BMI) greater than or equal to 18.5 kg/m2 and between the ages of 18 and
        65 years of age will be included in the study.

intervention.description: Subcutaneous adipose tissue will be obtained from liposuction/lipectomy to determine the types of immune cells

clinical_study.official_title: Immune Characterization of Subcutaneous Adipose Tissue

primary_outcome.measure: Determine the types of immune cells and the relative prevalence of each type and sub-type, in subcutaneous adipose tissue of normal weight, overweight and obese adults.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determine the relationships among specific types and subtypes of immune cells, adiposity and cardiometabolic risk.
